newsitem.title: CUBA: Colombia signs deal to buy Cuban vaccines.
newsitem.headline: Colombia signs deal to buy Cuban vaccines.

text.p: Cuba and Colombia on Friday signed a health cooperation agreement that foresees Colombian purchases of $5.8 million worth of Cuban medicines, mainly anti-meningitis and anti-hepatitis vaccines, the Cuban news agency Prensa Latina said.
The deal was signed by Cuban Health Minister Carlos Dotres and his Colombian counterpart, Maria Teresa Forero de Saade, who began a visit to the Communist-ruled island on Friday.

Prensa Latina quoted the Colombian minister as saying her country would buy vaccines against Type B meningococcal meningitis and against Hepatitis B produced by Cuba's health industry. The approximate total value of the planned purchases was $5.8 million.
Colombia also hoped to receive specialised training for its health workers from Cuba, Forero de Saade added.

Despite a five-year economic crisis triggered by the collapse of trade and aid ties with the former Soviet bloc, the Cuban government has invested considerable state funds in a bid to develop an international export industry in medicines and pharmaceutical products.
